newsitem.title: INDIA: Calcutta shares end shade lower on low volumes.
newsitem.headline: Calcutta shares end shade lower on low volumes.

text.p: Calcutta shares moved in a narrow range and closed a shade lower on Friday although technical support levels maintained mild buying support from foreign institutional investors (FIIs), brokers said.
They said that volumes fell as orders from Bombay traders were low. FIIs picked up select blue-chips like TISCO, L&T and ITC in small lots but local speculative interest was down.
Brokers said speculative sellers retreated in anticipation of a stiff backwardation charge likely to be levied at close of accounting period of the Calcutta exchange today.
Traders expected a backwardation charge of five rupees per share of Reliance Industries and one rupee per share on State Bank.

"Prices have fallen too much in too short a time. I am expecting a technical rally in prices of blue-chips in the short term. But higher levels are unlikely to sustain in the face of profit-taking thereafter," said Rishi Dhanuka of brokers Ratnabali Securities Ltd.
